messages.content:
You will read sentences and judge how natural they sound.
You will need to judge, on a scale from 1 to 7, how natural/plausible the presented sentence sounds, and explain yourself. 
All presented sentences will be grammatically correct.
Begin all your answers with "The naturalness score is"

Important: you are encouraged to use the whole scale.

Here are some examples:

The handyman repaired the car.
The naturalness score is 3 (handy generally fix things in house, but they might have some mechanic knowledge).

The policeman stopped the plane.
The naturalness score is 4 (it is a situation that might happen but is a bit unlikely).

Due to her excessive tiredness, Leah went to sleep early.
The naturalness score is 6 (it is plausible that someone tired would go to sleep early).

The farmer planted the fruits from which the seeds came.
The naturalness score is 3 (it's more likely to plant seeds than fruits).

The prison guard, which the inmate despised, robbed a bank.
The naturalness score is 4 (a prison guard robbing a bank might happen but is unlikely).

The table occupied most of the space in the kitchen.
The naturalness score is 5 (it is a somewhat plausible situation, maybe it is a small kitchen).

The doctor observed the patient from which the disease suffered.
The naturalness score is 1 (patients suffer from diseases, not the opposite),

He felt very hungry after eating a 300g steak.
The naturalness score is 4(a 300g steak is quite heavy, eating one and still being very hungry is unlikely).

The mechanic fixed the problematic cars with his eyes closed.
The naturalness score is 1 (it is highly unlikely that a mechanic can fix cars without seeing).

Because he slept nine hours, he woke up completely exhausted.
The naturalness score is 1 (sleeping is not supposed to make you tired).

We loved this place, we definitely won't come back again.
The naturalness score is 2 (why wouldn't they come back if they loved the place?).

The witness observed which policeman the robber had caught.
The naturalness score is 2 (in general, policemen catch robbers, not the other way around).

The waiter brought the drink.
The naturalness score is 6 (it is plausible that a waiter would bring a drink to a client).

The children scared the ghost.
The naturalness score is 3 (in general, children are scared of ghosts, not the opposite).

The plants scared the farmer.
The naturalness score is 2 (it is unlikely, but no impossible, that a farmer would be scared of plants).

The retailer folded the socks.
The naturalness score is 5 (it is somewhat likely that a retailer would fold tge socks in his shop).

The fire was put out by the firefighters.
The naturalness score is 7 (it is really plausible, the role of firefighters is to put out fires).

He searched the place and found there five golden rabbits.
The naturalness score is 3 (golden rabbits are a rather uncommon object).

He spent half an hour looking for a parking spot.
The naturalness score is 5 (there are quite a few busy cities in which this is a somewhat plausible situation).

All the students in the school appreciated the new math teacher.
The naturalness score is 4 (all the students loving the teacher might happen but is unlikely).

The teacher evaluated the student which the headmaster sent.
The naturalness score is 6 (it is plausible that a teacher would evaluate a student).

They spent their week-end at the beach, sipping iced tea.
The naturalness score is 6 (it is plausible that people would spend their week-end at the beach).

The baker prepared the cake.
The naturalness score is 7 (it is a really plausible situation, the role of the baker is to prepare cakes).

After sending the mail, he went and celebrated with a bottle of coke.
The naturalness score is 5 (it is a somewhat plausible situation, maybe it was an important mail).

She recommended him not to spend his entire savings on a big car.
The naturalness score is 7 (it is a sensible advice not to spend everything on a car).

The teacher scolded the shoe.
The naturalness score is 1 (there is no reason for a teacher to scold a shoe).

I'm so thirsty, can you please pour me a glass of water?
The naturalness score is 7 (it is highly plausible that someone thirsty would like to drink water).

The farmer bought a ski.
The naturalness score is 2 (it is weird for a farmer to buy a ski)
The waiter watched the chef.
The naturalness score is 6.
